case_title: NASEEBULLAH KHAN vs GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN through Secretary, Industries Department, Civil Secretariat, Quetta and 2 others
respondant: Government of Balochistan through Secretary, Industries Department, Civil Secretariat, Quetta
complaint_summary: The appellant challenged his dismissal from service, alleging wrongful termination, unconstitutional actions, and denial of the opportunity to be heard.
investigation_summary: An inquiry revealed that the appellant fraudulently withdrew Rs. 195,246.02 using forged documents. He repaid the amount but failed to provide a satisfactory explanation for the withdrawal.
judgment_summary: The Tribunal found no legal defect in the orders dismissing the appellant from service. His reinstatement was deemed unlawful and contrary to relevant laws and procedures. The appeal was dismissed as baseless.
legal_arguments: Appellant argued wrongful termination and denial of due process.
Respondents argued termination was lawful due to fraudulent actions and unsatisfactory service record.

legal_terms.Fraudulent withdrawal: Illegal acquisition of funds through deception

words_and_phrases.Condemned unheard: Denied the opportunity to present one's case

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the dismissal of Naseebullah Khan from service due to fraudulent withdrawal of funds and unlawful reinstatement. The Tribunal upheld the dismissal, citing adherence to legal procedures and lack of merit in the appellant's claims.

financial_dispute.allegation: Fraudulent withdrawal based on forged document

respondents_contentions: Initial appointment was ad hoc and extended time to time
Reinstatement was unlawful and against recruitment quota
Termination was lawful and appeal time-barred

tribunal_observations: Authorities failed to follow laws and rules
Rules changed to benefit specific individuals
